text: Lieutenant Colonel John McCrae (November 30, 1872 â€“ January 28, 1918) was a Canadian poet and soldier in World War I who is best known for writing the poem "In Flanders Fields" after seeing the death of his friend the day before. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America == Notes == Category:1872 births Category:1918 deaths Category:Canadian military people Category:Canadian poets Category:Military personnel of World War I Category:People from Guelph
title: John McCrae
